snippet: Mr. Thayer developed ideas for concealing troops, battlefield equipment, battleships and submarines. Also, the Jewish Museum explores fake heirlooms.
abstract: Eve M Kahn Antiques column; Williams College Museum of Art in Williamstown, Mass, will display collection of unpublished art work and photos by painter Abbott Handerson Thayer, along with artifacts donated by his estate, in exhibit ‘Not Theories but Revelations’: The Art and Science of Abbott Handerson Thayer; Jewish Museum in Manhattan announces exhibit The Fictional Portrait, featuring two portraits donated in 1950s alongside documents containing falsehoods about both works, as part of their Masterpieces & Curiosities series.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Thayer developed ideas for concealing troops, battlefield equipment, battleships and submarines. Also, the Jewish Museum explores fake heirlooms.

headline.print_headline: Tapping Into Nature for Art and Battle
headline.main: Unearthed Works by Abbott Handerson Thayer to Be Exhibited
